Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: elle18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and were upgraded to a room with a terrace. We did not stay in the hotel much so cannot rate the facilities but the room was ideal for what we needed. It was a spacious room and although the room was sparse it was clean and adequate for our stay. Although the hotel was slightly out of town we had no problems getting to the centre of town. The hotel is 5 minutes from Les Corts metro station on the green line and took about 15 minutes to get to Las Ramblas. If you are looking for a a reasonably priced hotel and don't mind having to take the metro in to town then I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business travellers could do better”
Reviews.Author: KAlcorn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for Camp Nou stadium, but for the business traveller it has some drawbacks. Internet access is expensive - 10c a minute - and the hotel cannot supply an iron (instead you will be charged to use the expensive laundry service). In short, be careful when looking at the prices for this hotel - it may seem a bargain but you can easily incur 25 euros a day in extra costs by the time you have paid for breakfast & internet access. There is a lack of restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, and if you are visiting to attend a congress at the CCIB you are nearly one hour away.

Reviews.Title: “stillers”
Reviews.Author: italysergey Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: In the restaurant of Hotel tryed to still my beg. No security! Hotel even din't oppologise for that. But exapt that hotel fine and for save money you could stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the City and Football”
Reviews.Author: RC6670
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st trip to Barcelona and this hotel is exceptionally priced and only 150 yards from the Nou Camp. The rooms are very comfortable and the staff very helpful indeed speaking a number of different languages. Nothing seems to be too much trouble. If you get a chance to take in a game of football you must go. We were lucky enough to great tickets and saw Barca win 5-3 with Lionel Messi scoring a hatrick and breaking 2 records at the same time. We didn't eat at the restaurant due to the football but when we had breakfast which was all you can eat and had loads of varieties of food guests where saying how good their evening meal is. I will definitely coming back later in the year and I will be staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great location if you are going to camp nou”
Reviews.Author: bbeerbower
Reviews.Content: I spent one night @ the Rallye as I was attending a Barca football game. Couldn't have been a better location. You can see Camp Nou from in front of the hotel. About 2 blocks from one of the entrance gates, depending on which gate you access no more than 3 -4 blocks. There is a Metro Les Corts about 4 blocks away. several small restaurants between Les Corts and Rallye as well as a small shopping center. There is a Taller de Tapas (good tapas chain) across the street about 1 block down on the way to Camp Nou as well as several nice restaurants along the way. The hotel itself is nice, clean with comfortable beds. Staff was friendly, helpful and efficient. But the location can't be beat if you are attending a late night game or concert. Camp Nou holds 98,000 people so being within walking distance is a real plus- no waiting in line at the metro. I would definitely stay here again if I were going to a night concert or game at Camp Nou. 107 euros booked 2 months in advance- 134 euros booked 2 wks prior

Reviews.Title: “Don't choose this hotel to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: FrancescoDallolio
Reviews.Content: I and my wife, payment in advance,220 euro/day , without breakfast, 16+16 euro each every day, and if you want to get it you must book the day before! We arrived from Milan by Lufthansa in the morning(+++) and we reached the hotel at 10:30 AM.They made the Chek-in but the room was not ready till: from 13:00 until 15:00! We ask to change the dress to be able to attend the ITMA fair and they offer the pool changing room!!!Room very small, not so clean , very noisy air-conditioning system. We are here from 3 days NO BED LIMEN CHANGING! From the last 3 days I am asking to change the bed-sheet but they are not changing!(reflecting the low hotel cleaness attitude). WiFi on payment , NO FREE WIFI IN THE LOBBY , but just 30 minutes per day free, the others we must pay. Resuming, next time we'll go to Sheraton or Hilton or any luxury hotel and we'll save money and we relax our self becouse this NH Hotel Rallyes are not listening and doing whatever they want , at the cheap prices of 220 euro per day for a BAD 3 star hotel!(without breakfast, without Wi-Fy.) The payment in advance its a trap because one you pay , or you stay or you loose your money! VERY VERY BAD!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great City Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_Dominique
Reviews.Content: Firsty Barcelona was the best city I have ever been to. I Loved it. The Location of this hotel is right next to the Camp Nou which is great for football fans and we did the stadium tour. There is a swimming pool on the roof of the hotel and has excellent views of the football stadium. The room was very clean and comfortable a balcony. We spent evenings in la Rambla area which is 10 minutes on the metro (Underground/Subway). The metro station is just a few minutes walk up the road. Las Ramblas is great area full of resturants, shops and nightlife. Park Guell was a great sight to visit, originally based on an English garden city and meant to be a residential estate, it is just now a strange city park. very interesting. Barcelona Zoo is great aswell, if you like zoo's lol.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Isamp
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Nou Camp so busy on match days. There was very little noise from the street but I was on the 9th floor in a small room with a big balcony. The staff were very friendly and efficient, all seemed to have with excellent English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in BCN!”
Reviews.Author: ladyoftheair
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in May and loved it! Hotel is in a great location literally opposite Camp Nou. Althought quite far from the hustle and bustle of La Rambla, its no bad thing as the hotel is about a 5 min walk to Les Corts metro - from there it's dead easy to reach all of the main spots! The room itself was a little small, but then we had a huge terrace/balcony so it wasn't all bad..... the room probably could do with a kettle for tea/coffee but not v important. We didn't use the restaurant facilities in hotel so can't comment on that, but the swimming pool on the top of hotel was nice and quiet when we went.... and the staff were good too.... To top it off, FC Barcelona won La Liga when we were there, so we had front-row tickets to the open-top bus procession with the football team onboard on our terrace - a nice addition to the stay :-) I'd recommend the hotel if you don't intend on spending ALL your time in there, as it's a bit stuffy.....other than that, great value and i'd stay again. One point - I booked this through lastminute.com (eventually) - pleast don't! for some reason they debited my account without confirming the booking, then did the same to my boyfriend, then got our names wrong on the flight confirmation, more hassle than it was worth!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again....”
Reviews.Author: Oaksy5
Reviews.Content: "We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it is more a 2-3 star than full 3 star. Room was on the 3rd floor and we weren't disturbed by street noise. Lighting in the room was a bit poor and we could've done with an extra pillow each but I think you had to pay for them. TV isn't much cop but we were out so much we never really cared. Don't go for the breakfast, it's overpriced nonsense, about 15€ each, Head over to the shopping centre which sell bacon baguettes etc for a fraction of the price. The metro is a 5 minute walk away and is about 9 stops to the bustling La Rambla, so it's really accessible even for first timers to Barca, we each bought a T-10 ticket which done us for a couple of days then we just bought one between us for the last day. The Nou Camp Stadium is a 5 minute walk which we could see from our window. There is a couple of wee local bars across the road which we had a few jars in usually before we headed out for the night or on the way home, they were pretty friendly too. Never got to see the pool as the door was locked but maybe we were too late. Checkout was 12pm but we booked a late one and they charge 10€ per hr and they looked after our luggage for the rest of the day while we done a bit of sightseeing/shopping. The staff were ok but then there was the language barrier but we always got what we needed. Taxi to the airport costs around 20€ and we done this to & from the hotel. We'd stay here again because it's easy to get to and out of the hustle bustle of the city and the area seems pretty safe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shellc1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for my husbands birthday would recommend this hotel the room was big enough for the both off us the bathroom had a big walk in shower. We were at the front of the hotel but had no problem with the traffic noise. The metro is a short walk away and easy to use to get around barcelona. The Nou camp is a 5/10 min walk from the hotel. There is a small bar 2 min walk from the hotel called the ButyKlan the owners were lovely and made us feel welcome. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: antsinmypants08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as I was going to a match at the Camp Nou. The hotel was perfect for this, a couple of minutes walk. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was big for a city hotel, with a large bathroom and a balcony, we did not have any problem with noise even on match night. We only had breakfast in the hotel and it was of a good standard with plenty of choice, but the attempt at bacon and eggs was a dissaster. The area around the hotel was peaceful and relaxed with lots of families out and about. The Les Courts Metro station is a few minutes walk away and gets you to the Ramblas in about five minutes, so if you think this is too far out, think again.

Reviews.Title: “great for concerts/events at camp nou”
Reviews.Author: Lauren&Chris
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for the night of the u2 concert and it was excellent. it was literally probably 100-150m away from the camp nou and great to walk home from the concert to the hotel with no worries about metro/crowds etc. amazingly the noise of people on teh street really didnt bother us, despite being only on the 2nd floor and facing the street. rooms were clean, beds comfortable, bathrooms modern and spacious. staff were fine. roof top pool was brilliant after lugging our luggage from teh metro to the hotel (for the record, lots of stairs on the metro, whereas a taxi costs only 20 euro to the airport!). not the best hotel i have ever stayed in, but consistently good in every aspect and i cannot come up with any complaints. the only criticism i can come up with is that there is minimal restaurants around to eat dinner at!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the NH Rallye, a 3-star hotel, while on a business trip. It is very close to Metro station Les Corts (about a 200 meter walk) which is on the L3 line, and if you've been to Barcelona you know that the Metro is the best way to get around. I had a very nice room with a large bathroom and a large desk to sit at while working on my laptop (via wireless connection). The breakfast buffet was good at € 14.00 and the service was excellent. The bar next to the lobby was small but the service was also impeccable. Overall the hotel was not fancy, but for a business trip it was almost perfect -- almost, because the rate for the internet connection was appalling: € 22.00 for 24 hours! Terrible. However, since everything else was outstanding I give it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: FranciMilano
Reviews.Content: For Christmas' Holidays my wife, my 5 years'old boy and I, decide to spend 5 days in Barcelona. We knew the Hotel Chain NH Hoteles (very popular in Spain) since we spent a very nice week during the New years eve 2006/2007 (Malaga and Sevilla). We've chosen the NH Rallye as it was the best price for ourselves (an average of 100€per room including taxes, services and a wonderful breakfast Buffet!). It's a three stars hotel, very close to the Barcelona Football Stadium, just 5 minutes walking from underground station (that reaches Plaza Catalunya in just 7-10 minutes!); the bus stop is located just one minute walking outside the main entrance. My room was very comfortable, clean, with a huge bathroom/shower. Safety box and minibar were already available in the room, as an LCD TV. The buffet breakfast was very nice and tastefull, with different kind of sweets, ham, eggs, sausages, fruits, yogurth, juices, biscuits, cakes etc. etc (it was perfect also for my son, which is not a "gourmet"!). To summarize: good choice, good price, staff very professional and always delicious. To recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Break”
Reviews.Author: geordielady_7
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner had 5 days here and throughly enjoyed it. The roof top pool is a lovely spot for a chilled afternoon after exploring the faboulous city of Barcelona. The room was slightly on the small side, but if your having a min break away it doesnt really matter, as we hardly spent any time in the room at all. It is a fair distance from the centre, but you arent far away from the metro (very easy to use) and a taxi is cheap enough

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: bahbah
Reviews.Content: when we were staying at rallye hotel our biggest problem was our room. we stayed in a room without a window. it was really awful we couldnt get any fresh air, our room was dark and small. we tried to change the room but the hotel stuff wasnt helpful. it was dark four nights for us. but there was a small garden near the hotel it was very nice and there was a opencor market which was open eveyday to 2a.m. and there was metro station which few minutes walking away so you can go every where you want easily.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: PollyB
Reviews.Content: We were going to a concert at the Nou Camp (U2 - corking!), so booked this hotel because it is very close. As it was, we were in our room 20 minutes after the end of the concert, so it was just about perfect from that point of view. There was a mix up with our booking (the fault of the consolidator we booked through) which caused about half an hour's hassle, but once we were in, there were no problems. The room was a little on the small size (but I think we were given whatever was left because of the booking problem). However, there was a very large walk in shower and good facilities, view of Montjuc from our balcony, and it was surprisingly quiet given the location. Breakfast was also very good, and the terrace bar was nice. It wasn't the most central hotel, but only about 10 euros from Placa Catalunia in a taxi. Would definitely use again if we were going to the Nou Camp, but not for a more 'general' trip to Barca - we would stay somewhere more central.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Rallye
